# VZVirtioTraditionalMemoryBalloonDeviceConfiguration

**Class**

A configuration object that provides a way to reclaim memory from the guest system.

## Declaration

```swift
class VZVirtioTraditionalMemoryBalloonDeviceConfiguration
```

## Overview

Create a `VZVirtioTraditionalMemoryBalloonDeviceConfiguration` object when you want the ability to reclaim memory from the guest operating system. After creating this object, add it to the [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZVirtualMachineConfiguration/memoryBalloonDevices] property of your [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZVirtualMachineConfiguration] object. In response, the virtual machine provides a [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZVirtioTraditionalMemoryBalloonDevice] object, which you use to initiate memory-related requests with the guest system. Access that object from the [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZVirtualMachine/memoryBalloonDevices] property of [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZVirtualMachine].



## Creating the Configuration Object

- **init()**: Creates a memory ballon device configuration object to include with your virtual machine’s configuration data.

## Configuration

- **VZMemoryBalloonDeviceConfiguration**: The common configuration traits for memory balloon devices.

- VZMemoryBalloonDeviceConfiguration
